column1: on  a  wrongdoer  by  statute  or  a  judicial  decision.  Thus,  it  can  be  gathered  that  a
‘penalty’ is a consequential penal sanction provided by law on a person who has been
found to have contravened the law. The term ‘penalty’ appears to be a synonym to
the term ‘punishment’. And it mostly takes the form of an order the compliance with
which is mandatory, and  sometimes  has a monetary value.  Nevertheless,  the exact
meaning of the term ‘penalty’ remains non-definitive.
